phasing_details.phase_detail: Proposed development  shall be completed in a single phase

description: Single storey rear extension and alteration to external rear elevation involving removal and installation of steel staircase to provide Fire escape for first and second floor flats. (following demolition of the existing garage at the rear)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): LOCATION PLAN; BLOCK PLAN; DEN.PL.01 Existing and Proposed Ground Floor; DEN.PL.02 Existing and Proposed Rear Elevations and Existing West Elevation; DEN.PL.03 Existing and Proposed Front Elevations and Proposed West Elevation; DEN.PL.04 Existing and Proposed Roof Plan
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

| No part of the roof of the single storey projection shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  The fencing as shown on drawings shall also remain in place and shall not be removed.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and policies 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012).
